summary: This document is a 'Monday Morning Bulletin' email dated April 23, 2018, from the FBI's Violent Crimes Against Children Section Front Office. It summarizes several unrelated criminal cases from news reports, including a murder trial in West Virginia, a disappearance case in South Carolina, a sex trafficking sentencing in Indiana, a child pornography arrest in California, and an FBI-assisted investigation in Maryland. The document appears to be an internal briefing on recent news relevant to violent crimes against children.

persons.name: Lena Lunsford
persons.context: Mother accused of murdering her 3-year-old daughter Aliayah Lunsford in West Virginia. Prosecutors rested their case against her.

persons.name: Aliayah Lunsford
persons.context: 3-year-old girl who disappeared in 2011 and was allegedly killed by her mother, Lena Lunsford.

persons.name: Christina Flanigan
persons.context: Lewis County Prosecutor who wrapped up the state's case against Lena Lunsford.

persons.name: Tom Dyer
persons.context: Defense attorney for Lena Lunsford who pointed out inconsistencies in witness testimony.

persons.name: Jake Reger
persons.context: Chief Judge presiding over the Lena Lunsford murder trial in Lewis County.

persons.name: Timothy Da'Shaun Taylor
persons.context: Man named by federal authorities in the 2009 disappearance of Brittanee Drexel. Was allowed to fire his attorneys.

persons.name: Brittanee Drexel
persons.context: 17-year-old vacationer presumed abducted and slain in Myrtle Beach in 2009.

persons.name: Melinda Milton
persons.context: East Chicago woman sentenced to 17 years in prison for sex trafficking of a minor.

persons.name: David Gordon Weaks
persons.context: Fifth-grade teacher in San Diego arrested on suspicion of distributing child pornography.

persons.name: Kevin Maxwell
persons.context: Chief executive of the Prince George's County school system who announced the discovery of a hidden camera.

persons.name: Hank Stawinski
persons.context: Prince George's County Police Chief who jointly announced the hidden camera investigation.

connections.description: Lena Lunsford is the mother accused of killing her 3-year-old daughter Aliayah.
KC is Lena Lunsford's daughter who testified against her mother about the murder and cover-up.
DC is Lena Lunsford's daughter who testified against her mother about the murder and cover-up.
Christina Flanigan is the prosecutor presenting the case against Lena Lunsford.
Tom Dyer is the defense attorney representing Lena Lunsford.
Timothy Da'Shaun Taylor was named by federal authorities in the disappearance and presumed slaying of Brittanee Drexel.

events.title: Disappearance of Aliayah Lunsford
events.description: 3-year-old Aliayah Lunsford disappeared from her home in West Virginia.

events.title: Prosecution Rests in Lunsford Murder Trial
events.description: Prosecutors in the murder trial of Lena Lunsford rested their case after emotional testimony from her daughter KC.

events.title: Disappearance of Brittanee Drexel
events.description: 17-year-old Brittanee Drexel was presumed abducted and slain while on vacation in Myrtle Beach.

events.title: Melinda Milton Sentenced for Sex Trafficking
events.description: Melinda Milton was sentenced to 17 years in prison for sex trafficking of a minor.

events.title: David Gordon Weaks Arrested for Child Pornography
events.description: Fifth-grade teacher David Gordon Weaks was arrested on suspicion of distributing child pornography.

keyFacts: This document is an FBI internal bulletin summarizing news reports about violent crimes against children, not directly related to Jeffrey Epstein.
The Lena Lunsford murder trial involved testimony from her daughters who claimed they kept secret for five years that their mother killed their 3-year-old sister.
Timothy Da'Shaun Taylor, linked to Brittanee Drexel's 2009 disappearance, was allowed to fire his attorneys, potentially affecting his guilty plea in an unrelated case.
Melinda Milton was sentenced to 17 years for sex trafficking of a minor after running a prostitution business advertised on Backpage.com.
The FBI's Baltimore Field Office was assisting Prince George's County police in investigating a hidden camera found in a public-school office.
